meanings.definition: A type of bird found in Australia, known for its loud and melodious call.
meanings.sent1: The friarbird perched on the tree branch and sang a beautiful song.
meanings.sent2: I saw a friarbird flying gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The friarbird chirped so loudly that it woke up the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as melodious as a friarbird's song.
meanings.sent5: The colorful friarbird stood out among the other birds in the forest.

meanings.definition: To refer to a specific species of honeyeater bird with a distinctive patch of bare skin on its face.
meanings.sent1: I friarbirded the bird with the unique patch on its face in my birdwatching journal.
meanings.sent2: She always friarbirds the honeyeater with the bare skin patch when she sees it.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly friarbirded the bird with the funny face to his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her nickname for him was 'friarbird' because of his distinct facial feature.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled when she said she would friarbird the bird with the funny face.
